http://www.nature.com/nature/journal/v451/n7175/full/451108b.html
 The Editorial in Nature has defined Evolution as a Fact on par with Atoms and Heliocentrism. It also cites 3 websites, one US government, one scientific and one EU on evolution's status which I've linked to below.
 http://www.nap.edu/catalog.php?record_id=11876
 http://www.sciohost.org/ncse/kvd/Padian/Padian_transcript.html#class
 http://assembly.coe.int/Main.asp?link=/Documents/WorkingDocs/Doc07/EDOC11297.htm

I notice you haven't gotten many replies yet. I think we've chased most of the creationists out of here in recent days, and the editorial in Nature is like a mathematician coming out with a paper saying "2+2=4" to the rest of us. ;)
 
 I think it's good they finally did this though. The whole thought by science was "there's nothing to debate, so we'll ignore the creationists. They'll go away when everyone starts laughing at them." Trouble is, the religious fundamentalists have too much political clout in America atm. Not enough people in power were laughing. Maybe this will help put the "controversy" to rest.

I also noted that the National Academy of Sciences, in the Preface to a new publication, Science, Evolution, and Creationism, states that evolution is a fact. The publication is available for free down load at the site.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Nature:- Evolution is a fact
